Why are frames #1 and #2 the same for these logs but not the 3rd one? Is is the issue with the first sample being a snapshot of the world?
content.html: Why are frames #1 and #2 the same for these logs but not the 3rd one? Is is the issue with the first sample being a snapshot of the world?

content.raw: `state.log` and `state2.log` have a double pendulum model, while `state3.log` has a much more static world with a few boxes. Probably, when you hit the record button you create a new sample and then, at the end of the current iteration you do it again (both samples have the same sim time but different wall time and states). In the case of `state3.log`, when you hit the record button we create the new sample but it takes a few iterations until the state changes (we moved the box). If the state doesn't change we don't log new samples.
content.html: state.log and state2.log have a double pendulum model, while state3.log has a much more static world with a few boxes. Probably, when you hit the record button you create a new sample and then, at the end of the current iteration you do it again (both samples have the same sim time but different wall time and states). In the case of state3.log, when you hit the record button we create the new sample but it takes a few iterations until the state changes (we moved the box). If the state doesn't change we don't log new samples.
